result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin L Sexton

records.addlTxt: ec: DA, Atty Rumpf, DHS/MMHI; ae 10/21/22
Proposed Order for Competency Examination
Competency hearing on December 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Competency hearing on October 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ml] Case called at 2:31PM
Defendant Justin L Sexton did not appear.  Attorney Amber K. Rumpf appears. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This file is scheduled for a Competency Hearing, however Att Rumpf states that the competency examination appears to have not been completed.
The State advises that it would not be opposed to setting this matter over with enough time for the parties to contact the examining health professional.
The Court requests that Attorney Rumpf be on stand-by if a new order needs to be drafted. 

recess 2:34PM

NEXT: Competency Hearing on 10/21 at 3:00PM

[Clerk's inserted note: Post Hearing - the Court learns through court staff that notification was received that the Defendant was stopped on a Law Enforcement Traffic stop on his travel to this hearing. The Court directs its JA to relay the next court date to the Defendant.]
ec/pc: DA, Atty Rumpf, DHS/MMHI(7/6/22--ma)
Proposed Order for Competency Examination
Competency hearing on August 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 10:31am 
Defendant Justin L Sexton in court with Attorney Amber Rumpf.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rumpf raises competency concerns, noting that competency was raised in an out-of-county case and there was a competency examination report filed. There is also a second competency examination currently being done in which Dr. Marcus is appointed as the examiner. 
The Court finds probable cause on the four corners of the Complaint.  The Court orders a competency evaluation to be completed by DHS. 
recess 10:37am 

NEXT:  (1) Attorney Rumpf is to submit a proposed order for competency examination,  (2) Competency Hearing on August 18th at 2:30pm
Status conference on July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justin Sexton appeared at 10:02am, apologized for being late, Clerk provided him next court date and Atty Rumpf's phone number(s)//ma

[ma] Case called at 9:40am
Attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Don Petig appears for preliminary hearing. 
Defendant Justin L Sexton does NOT appear.

ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance. 

Atty Rumpf has no explanation for Mr. Sexton's non-appearance; notes he has cases pending in other counties where competency was raised.

ADA Parson does not object to a status be scheduled after 5/18/22 (next scheduled hearing in Green Co.)

Scheduling is discussed.
recess:9:43am 
NEXT: Status on 7/1/22 at 10:00am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Rumpf
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ae] case called 11:20 AM Defendant Justin L Sexton in court.  ADA Michaels  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no presence at N6728 County Trunk Y in the Town of Milford or Hartwig Motorsports
--no contact with Hartwig Motorsports
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 11:25 am
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on  4/20/22 at 11:00 am  (2) Preliminary Hearing on 5/3/22 at 9:30 am
